items.content:
Freelance Writer

Company: Well Authored
Location: New York

Job Type: Freelance

Description

Calling all content writers!

WellAuthored.com is seeking versatile, experienced writers to contribute at least eight articles every week, each between 600 and 1,200 words. Stories are assigned by editors and cover a wide range of topics for a variety of clients and businesses. Each article must include between one and four embedded links (provided to you by the editors) that are SEO-driven for the clients. There are no interviews or sourcing required for the pieces, but some light research will be necessary to ensure a conversational-but-expert voice. Rates vary depending on story length, number of embeds and writing experience, but start at $15 per 600-word story and go up from there. Pay is distributed to writers weekly and on a per-article basis.

Editors will walk you through the entire process and provide feedback on all pieces. This is a great opportunity for consistent, remote freelance work with weekly payouts!

Selected candidates will be given paid test article assignments (up to six), each of which will be due within 24 hours. Once a writer passes the trial period, he or she will be contracted for at least eight articles each week.

For more information and to apply, send your cover letter, resume, and links to website and/or three recently published clips to [email protected]

Application Instructions

Send your cover letter, resume, and links to website and/or three recently published clips.

items.content:
Part-Time Content Writer

Company: Kayak Advisors
Location: Remote/Online

Job Type: Freelance

Description

Job Title: Part-Time Content Writer

Location: Remote/Online

Kayak Advisors (https://kayakadvisors.com) is seeking a regular writer with experience writing about kayaking and/or kayak fishing. The website provides reviews and vital advice regarding kayaking to readers, and we’re seeking a team member to create content that will suit the needs of a captive and knowledgeable audience.

As a writer, you will receive regular content assignments from the manager and editor, and you will be expected to complete the assignment within the guidelines given. Article topics can vary but may include product reviews, advice posts, “best of” posts, feature articles, and guest posts on various topics. Other projects may be requested as the working relationship grows. Further revisions may be requested after work is submitted for review.

Requirements

  • Native English speaker.
  • The ability to write at least two articles per week. These articles usually are about 1000-2000 words each, but on occasion may require more. More articles may be requested (but would not be mandatory) over time.
  • The ability to implement editor feedback into future writing.
  • Experience writing for online venues and websites.
  • Experience with Kayaking and/or aquatic sports. This includes basic product knowledge, safety procedures, and standard practices.
  • Familiarity with AP style.
  • Can complete standard article requests within three days’ time.
  • Strong research skills.
  • Can take SEO concerns into consideration when writing content.
  • Can keep a consistent line of communication open with managers and editors.
  • Familiarity with Google Docs, Google Sheets, and Microsoft Word.

Additional Preferences

  • A degree in English or closely related field.
  • Previous experience writing with WordPress.
  • Knowledge of how to tailor content so that it can maintain a strong social media presence.

What We Provide

  • Compensation will be .05-.07 cents per word, with potential changes made for non-standard projects.
  • Tools and training necessary for the success of your writing and content for Kayak Advisors

Please Do the Following When Submitting Your Application:

  • In your application please put the word “aquatic” at the top. Applications that do not follow this step will be disregarded.
  • Please include three samples of your work. If possible, send samples as closely as closely related as possible to the content that Kayak Advisors publishes.

Answer the following questions:

  1. What types of writing have you done in the past?
  2. What skill sets do you have that make you think you would be a perfect fit for Kayak Advisors?
  3. What is your experience with kayaking and aquatic sports?
  4. What is your experience writing about these topics?
  5. What is your availability to work?
  6. What separates your writing from the rest?
  7. Is there anything else you’d like us to know about you?

Submit any other information or documents that you think will be helpful in reviewing your application.

Send your application to [email protected]

Note:

We will own the exclusive rights to any content, it must not be shared, published or appear anywhere else either in print or online without our expressed permission.

Application Instructions

Send your application to [email protected]

Company: eZdia Inc
Location: Home Based
Job Type: Contract

Description

Do you have a solid work ethic? Do you stick to deadlines? Do you enjoy writing copy for blogs and eCommerce websites? If you answered “yes” to these questions, we’d love to hear from you.

CrewMachine is looking for experienced writers to create high-level copy for some of the biggest eCommerce companies around. We have a range of ongoing projects in immediate need of solid writers, including product content, blogs, and buying guides. If your application is successful, you could be working on anything from product descriptions and landing pages to buying guides and blurbs relating to tech, fashion, home goods, hardware tools, office supplies, and more.  

The application process is simple, but rigorous. We are looking for the best to join our team.

We need contributors who:

  • Are native to USA, CA, AU, or UK with English as their first language
  • Can produce compelling and flawless copy
  • Are familiar with SEO
  • Can follow instructions
  • Can positively accept and apply feedback
  • Can stick to deadlines
  • Have experience writing product copy
  • Submit only unique content
  • Are capable of doing thorough research
  • Understand what a reputable source is

Get started by taking our mini test: https://goo.gl/AvapjZ

items.title: Freelance Writers for SaaS Blogs
items.content:
Freelance Writers for SaaS Blogs

Company: Work Hounds
Location: Anywhere

Job Type: Freelance

Description

We're a content agency that works exclusively with SaaS companies. We create blog strategies and write content that's engaging and compelling, while also being optimized for SEO.

We're looking for freelance writers to help us write content for our growing client-base, with niches ranging from marketing, sales, small business/entrepreneurial topics and much more.

What you'll be writing

The articles will be long form (1500 words on average), tactical and educational style content. Think listicles and how-to guides.

You'll also be expected to include links to relevant resources, add data/stats, screenshots and other elements that make content helpful and enjoyable.

We'll give you the topics/keywords and a content brief for each article.

Here are some examples of the style of writing we're looking for:

https://coschedule.com/blog/project-management-plan-template-for-marketers/

https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/dunning-kruger

https://blog.trello.com/avoid-the-seagull-effect-30/60/90-feedback-framework

https://later.com/blog/instagram-hacks/

This gig is for writers who:

  • Have a great understanding of SEO
  • Know how to write amazing content that keeps readers engaged
  • Are comfortable writing for a variety of niches
  • Are willing to do research

Application Instructions

Apply here:
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSd2i6F4UDDjERnSZqmbNC6Yr5w0WBKg9da97EFBDsOmYZ1ZEA/viewform?usp=sf_link

items.title: Be part of the writer's community who are helping travelers and hotels around the world
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Be part of the writer’s community who are helping travelers and hotels around the world

Company: Arrivedo
Location: Anywhere

Job Type: Freelance

Description

We want to change the way everyone travels. We want travelers to experience the best local insights every time and make the most out of their trip. This is your chance to help us change that.

Arrivedo works with a community of more than 1600 international freelance writers, (including, but not limited to) travel-oriented bloggers, authors, literature and creative writing students who create Neighborhood Guides for hotels all over the world. We currently host over 650 Neighborhood Guides for hotels in more than 120 cities around the globe, providing our services to renowned international chains like JW Marriott, Waldorf-Astoria, Four Seasons, Westin Hotels & Resorts, Ritz-Carlton, as well as B&Bs, hostels and boutique hotels in remote locations around the globe.

What does the Arrivedo Writers Community do?
Help travelers with local recommendations you share in a hotel’s Neighborhood Guides.


How do THEY do it?
1st: Outreach to hotels: Approach hotels via email or in person offering to set up their writer’s profile in Arrivedo. (We provide support, resources, and incentives to help you)

2nd: Gather hotels local recommendations: Interview hotel staff to collect the hotel’s local recommendations and insights into their neighborhood.
3th: Create a Neighborhood Guide: Use Arrivedo’s editor to create 8-10 short articles showcasing the hotel’s local recommendations from themes ranging from routes, gastronomy, nightlife, cultural activities, essential tips and more. Here is an example Neighborhood Guide from Hotel Majestic in Chicago: https://arrivedo.com/dest/en/chicago/hotel/the-majestic-hotel-3.

 

Why do THEY do it?
With Arrivedo you have the chance to go beyond and help travelers to experience the world in a different way with your written word. You have the opportunity to share and learn about other cultures. The unique community of Arrivedo Writers helps you with the best tips on how to communicate your ideas, outreach and even get to know others around the globe.

 

What are the benefits?

  • Getting certified as one of Arrivedo’s 1600 international travel writers.
  • Be part of our private network of Arrivedo Writers.
  • Being able to sell your writing services to any hotel in the world. Arrivedo does not take a commission from your deals with hotels. Transactions are 1-on-1 in between writers and hotels.
  • Improve your Sales skills. We assign you a coach to help you on the outreaching process and provide you with all needed material.
  • Be aware that hotels prefer to pay with free accommodation (normally 3 nights), but you can negotiate a monetary payment.

items.title: Freelance editor needed for long-term work
items.content:
Freelance editor needed for long-term work

Company: Team Polaris
Location: Anywhere

Job Type: Freelance

Description

Your job will entail editing casino and sportsbook reviews and articles to make sure that:

  1. The writing is concise (think FAQ or product manual-type voice and tone)
  2. Contains no fluff or humor.
  3. Has a natural, easy-to-understand flow. Subject-verb-object order, simple sentence structures, strong and confident vocabulary.
  4. Contains no flowery language.
  5. Is consistent in terms of tenses

You must be willing to follow our editorial guidelines.

Here's an example of the voice and tone we're going for: 888 casino review.

This file demonstrates the type of writing quality you would be working with on a regular basis. Some writing will be slightly better, some will be slightly worse. The difference won't be significant either way.

Please contact me if you're interested and include a relevant sample (change-track mode) if possible.

items.title: Content Manager
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=5, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
*Who are we?*

We are Zzish. Education technology’s most passionate pioneers. Our mission is to get the best education apps and resources into the hands of every learner in the world so that they can fulfill their potential. Our talented, enthusiastic team are building and scaling a data-driven, real-time insight and recommendation platform for teachers, parents, districts and government.


*Why Zzish? Why now?*

You’ll be joining Zzish at a pivotal point in our growth. We have 140,000 teachers in 170 countries who love our product and are seeing meaningful results with their students. We have world-class technical leadership and liberty to choose the latest and greatest technology to work with. Most importantly, we have a constantly evolving product roadmap which we believe will change the future of education forever.

The Content Manager at Zzish is an integral part of the team who engages with all departments to ensure product and marketing content engages teachers and students worldwide. You will be translating and breaking down curriculum aligned content into format that can be uploaded to our platforms. We are looking for a creative leader who has a background in education and can independently generate relevant content for our platform and to enhance user engagement. You will need to understand our audiences’ needs in order to inspire teachers and educators, particularly in the United States.


*You will…*

* Research, create and edit interesting and relevant content for: Quizalize (a Zzish platform), weekly blog articles, social media platforms, email marketing
* Resource copyright free curriculum content to develop educational quizzes, translate into a clear format that can easily be coded by our development team
* Manage and engage in the development of educational quiz content that meets our customers’ needs
* Organise and distribute weekly emails to users about product updates, educational topics and events
* Develop a content calendar which coincides with the academic year
* Understand how and when to reach out to teachers and support users effectively
* Gather user research and analyse content use to inform and steer new content ideas
* Ensure that all content is within the style, tone and message that Zzish wants to convey
* Conduct quality control across Zzish platforms to ensure the content is relevant and age appropriate
* Stay up-to-date with education market developments and industry trends
* Produce content inline with our growth plans and business priorities
* Manage and build relationships with internal teams, teachers and freelancers who support in content writing
* Nurture freelancers to produce content, ensuring timelines are met and style and tone are on brand.

*Skills and experience...*

* A background in Education is essential to understand our user base, the school systems and processes
* Strong copywriter and editor, with excellent grasp of English grammar
* Really comfortable disseminating content into excel spreadsheets
* Ability to produce content for social media platforms
* Exposure to a Content Management System (CMS), preferably Wordpress and ideally some experience in HTML
* Familiar with customer engagement tools such as Intercom and Mailchimp
* You will be an accomplished organiser and planner with great communication skills

*You'll get...*
* Competitive salary in line with experience
* Share options: when we achieve our goals these will be worth more than the annual salary
* A Perkbox.com account with discounts for a number of retail and lifestyle companies and salary sacrifice benefits such as our cycle to work scheme.
* Team socials, snacks and Diet Coke
* An impressive network of mentors and investors
* To join and learn from a team of passionate and super talented people
* The chance to use your talent for the social good!

items.title: Community Manager
items.content:
Who are Quill?
If you ask Deloitte Fast 50 or Santander Breakthrough50, they’d say we’re one of Britain’s most exciting and disruptive businesses. If you ask our team, they’d say we’re a no-politics, people-first company where exceptionally smart individuals get the chance to have their voice heard and potential fulfilled (then pushed that extra bit more).
And if you ask our clients, they’d say we’re the content production partner they rely on to rapidly create high-quality editorial, video and images to drive online sales. To date, we’ve produced over 40 million words of on-brand content – in 29 languages and counting – for 170+ of the world’s most prestigious brands, including eBay, Farfetch and Google.

We do that through a combination of our unique methodology, our global network of ~2500 screened freelance creatives and Quill Cloud, our content production management tool.

What does being a Community Manager at Quill involve?
In this brand new position, you’ll take a leading role in managing and engaging our global Network of 2,500+ creative and editorial freelancers. You’ll take ownership of innovating and implementing exciting Network-wide programmes, designed to make Quill the company freelancers want to work with. You’ll be responsible for proactively solving Network-focused problems, from individual issues to process flaws, and will set the standard for excellence in communication, both on a one-to-one basis when responding to queries and to the entire Network when launching new initiatives for them to take part in.

These are the skills you’ll need for the job:
Change management skills: can plan and execute the successful implementation of large-scale changes that affect both in-house and remote teams

Leadership: can motivate in-house and freelance colleagues to support on and participate in Network-focused initiatives

Business nous and strategic thinking: can balance understanding of the needs of different elements of the business and develop and execute engagement strategies in line with these needs

Analytic ability and enthusiasm for problem solving: can proactively and consistently analyse ways of working and embrace the opportunity to continually make things better

Empathy paired with pragmatism: can instinctively empathise with others and balance the drive to help with a pragmatic assessment of the circumstances and the needs of all of your stakeholders

Excellent one-to-one communication skills: can take active steps to understand the root of queries or issues and select the appropriate format for their expertly crafted comms – whether one-to-one or at a group level

And here’s the experience you need:
You must have experience of developing an idea from initial concept to successful roll-out, including planning the project, getting buy-in from key stakeholders and managing the implementation process and the associated communications

You must have experience of managing a large team or community, ideally with a number of remote individuals, and motivating them to deliver excellent results

You must have a wealth of experience in handling tricky and sensitive communications – both one-to-one, and at a higher level

Why should I join Quill?
Like most startups, we talk a lot about our culture. But for us, culture isn’t just words on a wall. It’s part of our recruitment process, our personal development plans and our day-to-day.

If any of this sounds like you, you’re looking for a spot on the right team:
Your integrity isn’t for sale. You’re a what you see is what you get type of person who’s honest about their strengths and development areas.

You don’t settle for second best. It really, really matters to you that everything you do is excellent. And you don’t shy away from empowering your colleagues to share those standards.

10 minutes with nothing to do feels like an hour for you. You’re smart, energetic and driven, so you’re at your best when everything’s a little hectic.

You don’t like going through the motions or blindly following instructions. You leap into complex situations that don’t have an easy answer and relish the challenge of coming up with one.

The idea of a fixed ‘remit’ doesn’t appeal to you. Neither does waiting three years to get a promotion you earned two years ago. You think and act beyond your role.

You’re a fundamentally kind, respectful person, searching for a place filled with similarly kind, respectful people.

What are the benefits?
On top of joining the Quill family and all the benefits that come with that, you’ll also get:
25 holiday days per year plus UK bank holidays
A contributory pension
Our Summer Away Day (no stuffy meeting rooms in sight)
Monthly socials and lunches/breakfasts
Fortnightly Inspire Lunches – past lunches have included how the CEO manages his wellbeing, what today’s most disruptive businesses have in common and a crash course in Russian
A significant amount of time, expertise and attention put into your personal development, plus an unusually broad scope for rapid career progression

Quill is an equal opportunities employer.
